snippet: Kentucky won its eighth national championship Monday with five starters, all underclassmen, that are expected to enter the N.B.A. draft.
abstract: University of Kentucky's victory in the NCAA men's basketball championship draws attention to the NBA's so-called 'one-and-done' rule, which requires that players be one year removed from graduating from high school before they are eligible for the draft; critics say that the rule gives college basketball players little incentive to excel academically as they are intent on going professional, as Kentucky's five starters, who are all underclassmen, are expected to do.

byline.original: By PETE THAMEL and GREG BISHOP

lead_paragraph: Kentucky won its eighth national championship Monday with five starters, all underclassmen, that are expected to enter the N.B.A. draft.

headline.seo: Kentucky Built a Title Team on Underclassmen Expected to Leave Early for the N.B.A.
headline.main: After Title Run, the Starting 5 Rush for the Exit
headline.print_headline: After Title Run, The Starting 5 Rush the Exit
